appUpdate.available: An update to version v{{version}} is available.

grid.noBucketsDescription: Buckets are typically located in your Scoop installation's buckets directory
grid.title: Installed Buckets

page.description: Manage Scoop buckets - repositories containing package manifests

search.description: This will download and search through the complete Scoop bucket directory maintained by the community. This includes thousands of buckets with various quality levels.
search.disableCommunityTitle: Clear expanded search cache and return to verified buckets only
search.expandNote: This will download ~14MB initially, but only ~0.3-4MB (depending on filters) will be stored as optimized cache. The search will include community buckets of varying quality and maintenance levels. After the initial download, all searches will be instant and offline-capable.
search.searchForBuckets: Search for new buckets to install

searchResults.title: Search Results
searchResults.tryAdjustTerms: Try adjusting your search terms or enable expanded search to explore more buckets.

addShimModal.argumentsHelp: Arguments to pass to the executable.
addShimModal.title: Add a new Shim

cacheManager.deleteAll: Are you sure you want to delete all {{count}} cached files? This action cannot be undone.
cacheManager.deleteFiles: You are about to delete {{count}} cached file(s) for the following {{packageCount}} package(s):
cacheManager.name: Name
cacheManager.noCachedFiles: There are no cached package files to manage.
cacheManager.title: Cache Manager

checkup.description: This tool checks for common problems with your Scoop setup.
checkup.title: Scoop Health Check

cleanup.description: Free up disk space by removing old package versions and outdated download caches (this will ignore auto-cleanup constraints).
cleanup.title: Scoop Cleanup

commandInput.description: Execute Scoop commands directly from here.
commandInput.switchInputMode: ↓　Click here to switch input mode.
commandInput.title: Scoop Commands

proxySettings.description: Set the Scoop proxy's address. Not the Rscoop GUI.
proxySettings.loadError: Could not load Scoop proxy setting.
proxySettings.title: Scoop Proxy

list.ciVersionNote: (CI version, Scoop may not be able to update automatically)
list.name: Name

language.description: Select your preferred language for the application interface.
language.title: Language

messages.initTimeout: Initialization is taking longer than expected.
messages.initTimeoutReason: This might be due to a slow system or Scoop configuration issue.
messages.initTimeoutShow: Initialization timed out. Showing interface anyway...

msiNotice.description: Everything is okay — this isn't an error. Windows launched app in a limited mode right after installation.
msiNotice.detailsDescription: When launched directly from an MSI installer, Windows runs the process in a restricted execution context. This causes:
msiNotice.detailsPoint4: Process inherits MSI security token limitations
msiNotice.detailsSolution: This prevents normal initialization. Relaunching outside MSI context fixes this.
msiNotice.instruction: To enable all features, please close and reopen the app from the Start Menu or Desktop shortcut.
msiNotice.title: MSI Launch Notice

noPackagesFound.noInstalledYet: You don't have any packages installed yet.
noPackagesFound.noMatchCriteria: No installed packages match your current filter criteria.
noPackagesFound.title: No packages found

packageInfo.ensureSoftwarePresent: Ensure the software package is present in the target repository
packageInfo.errorSwitchingVersion: Failed to switch to version v{{version}}: {{error}}
packageInfo.name: Name
packageInfo.title: Information for {{name}}

scoopStatus.allGoodMessage: Scoop is up to date and all packages are in good condition!
scoopStatus.bucketsOutOfDate: Scoop bucket(s) are out of date. Click 'Go to Buckets' to get the latest changes.
scoopStatus.networkFailure: Network failure occurred while checking for updates.
scoopStatus.scoopOutOfDate: Scoop is out of date. Run 'scoop update' to get the latest changes.
scoopStatus.title: Scoop Status

bar.placeholder: Search for apps from local Buckets

about.customizedVersion: A customized fork of Rscoop by Kwensiu
about.description: A modern GUI client for Scoop, designed to simplify package management on Windows.
about.latestVersion: You're already using the latest version (v{{version}})!
about.pleaseReportIssues: Please report any issues to my fork repository.
about.scoopUpdateInstruction: Use {{code}} in your terminal to update.
about.updateAvailableDialog:
Update to v{{version}} is available!

Release notes: {{body}}
about.updateComplete: Update has been installed successfully. The application needs to restart to apply the changes.
about.updateReady: Version v{{version}} is ready to install.
about.updateViaScoop: This app was installed via Scoop. Please use Scoop to update this application instead.

appData.clearCacheDescription: Clear temporary files, logs, and WebView cache
appData.description: Managing data files generated by Rscoop
appData.factoryResetDescription: Clear all app data, settings, and cache, and restore to the initial state
appData.loadError: Could not load application data info
appData.title: Rscoop Data (Beta)

autoCleanup.cleanOldVersionsDescription: Keep only the most recent versions of packages. Versioned installs (using @version) are always preserved.
autoCleanup.cleanOutdatedCacheDescription: Remove stale downloaded artifacts that are no longer needed, freeing disk space.
autoCleanup.description: Automatically tidy up old package versions and outdated cache assets after install, update, or uninstall operations.
autoCleanup.title: Auto Cleanup

bucketAutoUpdate.autoUpdatePackagesDescription: Run full package update after bucket refresh
bucketAutoUpdate.customIntervalDescription: Define a custom schedule (minutes, hours, days, weeks).
bucketAutoUpdate.description: Rscoop will automatically run updates on all installed buckets to keep manifests fresh.
bucketAutoUpdate.silentUpdateDescription: When enabled, auto-updates will run in the background without showing popups
bucketAutoUpdate.title: Bucket Auto Update

debug.description: Enable debug mode to access detailed system information, logs, and troubleshooting tools.
debug.title: Debug Mode

defaultLaunchPage.description: Choose which page to display when the application starts.
defaultLaunchPage.title: Default Launch Page

heldPackages.description: Packages on hold are prevented from being updated via Rscoop or Scoop.
heldPackages.noPackagesHeld: No packages are currently on hold.
heldPackages.title: Held Packages Management

scoopConfiguration.autoDetectDescription: Automatically detects Scoop installation using multiple methods: environment variables, scoop config command, and common installation paths.
scoopConfiguration.description: Set the installation path for your Scoop directory. Changes will take effect immediately.
scoopConfiguration.detectError: Failed to detect Scoop path. Please make sure the SCOOP environment variable is set correctly.
scoopConfiguration.invalidDirectory: Directory exists but Scoop structure is invalid. Missing 'apps' or 'buckets' directories.
scoopConfiguration.loadError: Could not load Scoop path setting.
scoopConfiguration.saveSuccess: Scoop path saved and applied successfully!
scoopConfiguration.title: Scoop Configuration
scoopConfiguration.validationError: Please enter a valid path first

startup.description: Configure whether Rscoop should automatically start when Windows boots.

silentStartup.description: When enabled, Rscoop will start minimized to the system tray without showing the main window.
silentStartup.title: Silent Startup

startup.title: Startup Settings

tray.notificationMessage:
Rscoop has been minimized to the system tray and will continue running in the background.

You can:
• Click the tray icon to restore the window
• Right-click the tray icon to access the context menu
• Change this behavior in Settings > Window Behavior

What would you like to do?

trayApps.description: Select applications to display in the system tray right-click menu
trayApps.enableTrayAppsDescription: Show application shortcuts in the system tray right-click menu
trayApps.helpText: By default, no applications are displayed. You can add applications to show from the list below and use the sort buttons to adjust the display order.
trayApps.manageTrayAppsDescription: Configure applications to display in the tray right-click menu
trayApps.title: Tray Applications

ui.UDABottonDescription: Change the visibility of the global 'Update All' button.

virustotal.description: Automatically check package downloads against VirusTotal to prevent installing malicious software. You can get a free API key from the VirusTotal website.
virustotal.invalidApiKey: Invalid API Key. Must be 64 lowercase hexadecimal characters.
virustotal.loadError: Could not load VirusTotal API key. Scoop may not be installed or configured correctly.
virustotal.saveError: Failed to save API Key. Please check the console for more details.
virustotal.title: VirusTotal Integration

windowBehavior.description: Enable tray support to allow Rscoop to run in the system tray when closed.
windowBehavior.title: Tray Support

multiInstance.message: You are running multiple operations simultaneously, which may affect performance and stability. It is recommended to wait for the current operation to complete before starting a new one.
multiInstance.title: Multi-Instance Operation Warning
